perturbation.original_text: 3.1 Compliance with Local Laws and Regulations The Manufacturer covenants that it is and will remain for the term of this agreement in compliance with any and all Local Laws and Regulations. This includes without limitation laws relating to business practice, workplace relations, safety and taxation.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1 Compliance with Suggestions The Manufacturer covenants that it is and will aim to comply with Local Laws and Regulations, but is not obligated to do so. This includes without limitation laws relating to business practice, workplace relations, safety and taxation.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'compliance with Local Laws and Regulations' to 'compliance with Suggestions,' the legally binding obligation is removed. This conflicts with various regulations that mandate compliance, creating uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction, but generally contradicts laws requiring regulatory compliance in business, workplace, safety, and taxation.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3 Rejection of defective products The Customer shall inspect all Products promptly upon receipt thereof and may reject any defective Product, provided that the Customer shall within seven (7) days after receipt of such alleged defective Product, notify the Manufacturer of its rejection and either: (i) request to destroy in field for credit of the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs (with approval), or (ii) request a Return Material Authorization ("RMA") number and within seven (7) days of receipt of the RMA number from the Manufacturer return such rejected Product to the Manufacturer. Products not rejected within the foregoing time periods shall be deemed accepted by the Customer. In the event that the Manufacturer determines that the returned Product is defective and properly rejected by the Customer, the Manufacturer shall credit to the Customer the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 Rejection of undesirable products The Customer may inspect all Products upon receipt thereof and may reject any undesirable Product. Rejection is at the sole discretion of the Customer, and no notification to the Manufacturer is required. All Products, regardless of condition or the passage of time, are subject to the Customer's ongoing approval.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'defective' is replaced with 'undesirable', removing the requirement for the product to be objectively flawed. The notification period and the process for RMA is removed completely. Furthermore, it now says 'all products are subject to the customer's ongoing approval'. This creates legal uncertainty around product acceptance and payment obligations, contradicting standard commercial practice and potentially applicable sales of goods laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially contradicts sale of goods laws and principles of contract law regarding acceptance and rejection of goods.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 Any and all disputes, claims or differences arising out of or relating to this agreement or the alleged breach thereto shall be settled by mutual consultation between the parties in good faith as promptly as possible but failing such amicable settlement, shall be decided by Arbitration by the Arbitration Committee of the International Chamber of Commerce located in Switzerland.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 Any disputes, claims or differences arising out of this agreement may be resolved through informal discussions. If resolution isn't reached, each party can choose their own method of dispute resolution.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the mandatory arbitration clause and replacing it with vague language about informal discussions and individual choices for dispute resolution, the enforceability and predictability of dispute resolution are significantly undermined. This contradicts standard practices that ensure clear procedures for resolving conflicts and may create ambiguity that renders the clause ineffective.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contradicts the principles of ensuring enforceable dispute resolution mechanisms in contracts.
